metadata.case_name: Girjadharji & Anr. v. Madho Ram & Ors.

facts.text: By a mortgage deed executed on June 22, 1922, Madho Ram, Sita Ram, Jai Ram and Lakshman, all sons of Pandit Raja Ram Pant Sess, mortgaged certain immovable properties in favour of Damodarji, son of Kamta Nathji, owner of the Kothi Joshi Shivanath Vishwanath for Rs. 8,000 advanced by cheque with interest at 12 annas per cent per mensem with quarterly rests.

On July 28, 1931, the said mortgagors and their sons executed a mortgage over the same properties in favour of Kothi Kamta Nathji Vishwanathji for Rs. 3,000 with interest at twelve annas per cent per mensem with quarterly rests, recited that Rs. 8,000 was advanced by cheque and utilised in paying the amount due under the earlier mortgage to Damodarji.
In 1935 the U.P. Agriculturists Relief Act No. XXVII of 1934 came into force.

On May 1938, Girjadharji, son of Damodarji, and Murlidharji, minor son of Gangadharji (another son of Damodarji), filed suit No. 33 of 1938 in the Court of the Additional Civil Judge, Banaras, against the mortgagors and their sons for recovery of Rs. 9,477-2-0 due as principal and interest up to date of suit under the mortgage deed of July 28, 1931.

Mortgagors claimed benefit of U.P. Agriculturists Relief Act 1934 in written statement; plaintiffs contended mortgagors were members of joint Hindu family, Sita Ram assessed to income-tax, hence not agriculturists under section 2(2).

Trial Court by judgment dated March 31, 1939 held Sita Ram's income-tax for 1931-32 did not exceed cess payable, so proviso to section 2(2) not apply, he was agriculturist; all entitled to benefits; scaled down to Rs. 9,497-14-1 due up to March 31, 1939, passed preliminary mortgage decree for sale.
In 1940 the U.P. Debt Redemption Act No. XIII of 1940 came into force.

On April 11, 1942, five judgment-debtors applied under section 8 of 1940 Act before Additional Civil Judge, Banaras: debt advanced in 1922, they were agriculturists, interest reduced to Rs. 4-8-0% pa from 1922, nothing outstanding; pray accounts from 1922 and amend decree.
Decree-holders objected: petitioners not agriculturists, joint family, Sita Ram paid income-tax at mortgage 1931 and application time, debt under 1931 mortgage not a loan under Act.
Decree-holders' pleader admitted all except Sita Ram were agriculturists under 1940 Act.

Sita Ram testified: teacher since 1907 at Harish Chandra Intermediate College, salary Rs.90 pm in 1930, paid income-tax Feb 1932-1936, not after; corroborated by Suraj Mani Tripathi (accountant 1930-1942) using acquittance roll: no IT deduction 1930-1931, first in Feb 1932.
Income-tax assessment form dated Feb 9, 1933 for 1931-32 on Rs.180 at Rs.1-14-0.

Additional Civil Judge Feb 22, 1943: Sita Ram not assessed to IT at application or 1931 mortgage date, agriculturists, loan under Act; accounts from 1922 as mortgagees same; principal/interest discharged, decree discharged.

High Court (Malik CJ, Prasad J) April 16, 1948: Sita Ram agriculturist status on 1931 immaterial as all agriculturists at suit date; s21 limits recovery to property, proviso s2(9) inapplicable; followed Ketki Kunwar v. Ram Saroop; dismissed appeal.
Appeal to Supreme Court on certificate under s110 CPC.

legal_issues.text: Whether the judgment-debtors-applicants were agriculturists entitled to apply under s8 of U.P. Debt Redemption Act 1940, specifically if Sita Ram was agriculturist (not assessed to income-tax exceeding cess), and if the decree relates to a 'loan' under s2(9).
Whether accounts should be reopened from 1922 (first mortgage) or 1931 (second mortgage), as mortgagees same or different.

petitioner_arguments.text: Judgment-debtors not agriculturists as Sita Ram assessed to income-tax at 1931 mortgage and application time, joint Hindu family.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 2(3)(b) proviso U.P. Debt Redemption Act 1940; s2(2) U.P. Agriculturists Relief Act 1934

petitioner_arguments.text: Debt under 1931 mortgage not a 'loan' under Act.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 2(9) proviso U.P. Debt Redemption Act 1940

petitioner_arguments.text: Accounts not from 1922 as mortgagees different.

respondent_arguments.text: Debt actually advanced 1922, agriculturists under 1940 Act, interest at reduced rate from 1922, nothing outstanding.
Sita Ram not assessed to income-tax before Feb 1932, salary Rs.90 pm below taxable limit in 1931.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Section 2(3) proviso U.P. Debt Redemption Act 1940

court_reasoning.text: Three pre-requisites for s8(1): applicant agriculturist, liable under decree to which Act applies (passed before commencement in suit relating to loan), decree pre-commencement. All satisfied: agriculturists at suit 1938 and application 1942 conceded except Sita Ram dispute.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Sita Ram not assessed to IT on July 28 1931 (first deduction Feb 1932, assessment Feb 1933); salary below limit; agriculturist on advance date, due date 1937, suit, application.

court_reasoning.text: Advance recoverable from agriculturists; 'recoverable' at time advance due; proviso s2(9) requires agriculturist at advance date but Sita Ram was; all agriculturists, decree in suit re loan.
Point on reopening from 1922 not specifically taken in objections; trial court factually held mortgagees same for judgment-debtors.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Not necessary to decide broader questions as appeal decided on simpler ground.

holdings.text: Judgment-debtors-applicants all agriculturists on relevant dates; decree relates to loan under s2(9); entitled to s8 benefits; courts below right.
No need to express opinion on High Court's interpretation of s21, s2(9) proviso, or Full Bench decision.

precedents_cited.relevance: High Court relied on it for agriculturists at suit date sufficient due to s21

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Debt Redemption Act No. XIII of 1940
statutes_cited.relevance: Defines agriculturist, loan, suit/decree to which Act applies; allows application to amend pre-commencement decrees by scaling down amounts for agriculturists.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Agriculturists Relief Act No. XXVII of 1934
statutes_cited.relevance: Definition of agriculturist; proviso re income-tax assessment.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Certificate for appeal to Supreme Court.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Finance (Supplementary & Extending) Act, 1931
statutes_cited.relevance: Reduced taxable minimum from Rs.2000 to Rs.1000 pa, enacted Nov 26 1931.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the appeal, holding courts below correct that judgment-debtors entitled to U.P. Debt Redemption Act 1940 benefits; decree in O.S. 33/1938 stands discharged as nothing due after scaling from 1922.
outcome.relief_granted: Decree amended/discharged in full per lower courts.

key_quotes.text: "It is clear from the wording of the sub-section that there are three pre-requisites for exercise of the right conferred by it, namely, (1) that the application must be by an agriculturist (2) that that agriculturist must be liable to pay the amount due under a decree to which this Act applies and (3) that that decree was passed before the commencement of this Act."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "The position therefore is that Sita Ram was not assessed to income-tax at the date of the advance in 1931 or on the due date under the deed, i.e., in July 1937, or on the date of suit in 1938 or on the date of the application under section 8 in 1942."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Key finding on agriculturist status resolving main dispute.
